I just want to give a bit of context with respect to the
Renewable engine credit market and how that works in the
United States.
Essentially right now you can buy what's known as a wreck.
A wreck is essentially an attribute that attests to a
Mega watt renewable energy that's generated by some source.
That could be like a wind farm in Idaho or a solar farm in
Texas.
That facility generates a mega watt and in doing so it is
Issued a renewable energy credit which it can then sell on.
What you'll have is utilities purchasing renewable energy
Credits to satisfy state requirements for green energy.
The problem is oftentimes these wrecks then get sold on again.
You're double counting the value of that green energy.
That was one of the first initial problems that we identified
With this system.
The other problem is it's kind of a meta system.
Yes the facilities that wind farm in Idaho is producing green
Energy and that does have a net positive effect on the global
Environment.
That doesn't actually mean anything at the local community
Level in Brooklyn where residents of that community may
Actually be purchasing those wrecks from third party
providers.
What that means is that the electrons that are actually
Produced off of that wind farm that you're buying your green
Energy from don't ever actually reach you.
So energy produced in the neighborhood within your local micro
Grid actually has the potential to make it to your house.
So there's less loss in transporting that energy.
You know transporting energy is actually pretty lossy.
Especially when summer comes along all the air conditioning
Turns on and the lines get hot and start sagging.
